data.title: Where's the taco hunt.
data.text: Nasty, nasty, nasty taco, this can't be famous. Frozen, fried taquito with little to no beef, drowned in water down paco tomato sauce. Don't waste your money or your time.

data.title: Chicos
data.text: Small place with a different kind of Tacos.  They are very tasty and I usually go to chicos when I am in El Paso.  People All over the country know about Chico's and it is occasionally mentioned on Facebook by people from different states. There were three locations and I always went to the Montana St location which may not be there any longer. I have been going to Chico's for 54 years.

data.title: El Paso landmark food
data.text: The tacos here are better than anywhere else. If you have ever lived in El Paso you have been to Chico's many times over. The tacos are special. Miss them when I am away from El Paso. A true El Paso place.

data.title: Acquired taste
data.text: This a local place that has been around for about 40 years or longer. The main attraction is rolled up 3 corn tortillas barely stuffed with a meat mixture drowned in a pool of a tomato liquid and topped with what appears to be government cheese. For locals, it's a hit. If you're from out of town or didn't grow up,on them then skip it but I would try their round hotdogs with chili beans. It's cheap eats.

data.title: Not for me.
data.text: This is a local favorite.  If you grew up in El Paso, you probably love it.  I thought their soupy concoction of a taco was awful.

data.title: Despite popularity, average Tex-Mex
data.text: Budget-friendly and filling, tasty but messy rolled tacos (most popular offering?)  slathered in a mildly-spicy tomato-based sauce and unidentifiable, shredded orange cheese.  Yummy.

data.title: Wonderful!!
data.text: I loved it!! The food was wonderful, fast and hot. Great Mexican food at affordable prices. I would eat there again!

data.title: Popular, cheap restaurant
data.text: Cheap fried food for someone on a shoestring budget. You can eat here for under $5. French fries, burgers and deep fried tacos.

data.title: You either love it or hate it, no middle ground
data.text: I personally love it, but I'm native to the area so I grew up on it. I usually get the tacos with extra cheese, but the hot dog,burritos, grilled cheese, and fries are good too.

data.title: No comprendo!
data.text: Crowded - for taquitos with cheese that won't melt, and I'm glad I could order without the horrid tomato broth they pour on each. Some locals swear by it, mostly following with, "it's drunk food".

data.title: School Enchiladas from 1989 or A Drunk's Dream Food
data.text:
Growing up in El Paso meant hearing about the "awesome" food at this bigoted establishment (please GOOGLE for full story).  The truth is that most of the people that like this food have a nostalgic attachment to being served the EPISD enchiladas during their elementary school days.
Otherwise, those loving this cuisine are in a state of drunkenness OR severe hangover.
The food is runny, heavy on "cheese"<--- not convinced that this is 100% dairy cheese.
Can it cure a hangover? Maybe.
Can it sober up someone who is drunk?  No. However, it may slow the amount of alcohol in someone's system because it is HEAVY.

Consumption of this food does hit something in the reward center of the brain but not because it is delicious...

data.title: One of a kind
data.text: Not for everyone. Make sure you ask a local how to order. You can't describe this place by review, it just needs to be tried. You will NOT find food like this anywhere else. It's an El Paso tradition and exclusive.

data.title: Cheap eats
data.text: Went to El Paso for the day. My brother said we have to try Chico's so we did. Didn't know that the rolled taco was going to have a sauce that tasted like fideo poured over with cheese on top. This is not the norm in AZ. It was so good and only $2 and change. Now I can't eat them any other way.

data.title: Loved it
data.text: One thing to know is that the place is always packed. The service was great and the food was delicious.

data.title: I thought it was outstanding
data.text: I heard about this on a comedy video, have wanted to eat there for some time now. I was not disappointed! Although the food is not for everyone I would recommend at least try it!

data.title: Never had a taco like this before!!
data.text: This place is known for there rolled tacos.  It was delicious!!! They piled cheddar cheese on top with some type of red Mexican sauce.  The inside doesn't look like nothing much more than a burger joint inside, but don't let the outside of the place fool you.  Another thing on the menu I tasted was the hotdog which they use red hotdogs split in half and put on a hamburger bun with chili and mustard.  It's a great eat especially on a budget.

data.title: Rolled taco
data.text:
The rolled tacos were good. Good price. Long wait.
The tables were dirty, from the previous eater.
The bathroom was very dirty and out of TP...

data.title: greasy & dirty
data.text: Very popular place when I was a teen.  Very dirty & ugly.  The wait staff is behind the counter only & either don't speak much english or are too busy talking amongst each other.  The tacos were not good.  They were cold & swimming in grease.  If you like grease, this is your place.

data.title: An El Paso tradition
data.text: It's required that every time we visit El Paso we absolutely have to stop at Chico's for a double.  I get random cravings throughout the year for these deep fried, sauce slathered, cheese covered taquitos.  If you go be sure to send a scout to find a table, you're gonna need it.

data.title: Not Edible.
data.text: My husband and I are extremely open minded diners and stopped in El Paso to try Chico's after seeing it on some recommendation sites.  I was so sad to find out just how terrible the tacos were.  Maybe we came at a bad time, but it was extremely hard rolled tacos with cold tomato juice and unmelted cheese.  Could manage more than one bite without feeling sick.  Wish I had better words to say, but just don't. Reading the other reviews on here, it seems a lot of people enjoy it so maybe it was just a bad time for us to visit.
